tasks.name: Resting-state fMRI task
tasks.description: Participants underwent resting-state fMRI scans to analyze regional homogeneity (ReHo) differences between heroin relapsers and non-relapsers under methadone maintenance treatment (MMT). ReHo measures the coherence of intraregional spontaneous low-frequency blood oxygenation level-dependent signal fluctuations in voxel-wise analysis across the whole brain.
contrasts: Increased ReHo in bilateral medial orbitofrontal cortex, right caudate, and right cerebellum in heroin relapsers
Decreased ReHo in left parahippocampal gyrus, left middle temporal gyrus, right lingual gyrus, and precuneus in heroin relapsers
Positive correlation between altered ReHo in right caudate and heroin relapse rates or subjective craving response
